title: Seat Cable and Latch - Check

body.body: The key must fit the lock and turn easily.
When the key is turned, the seat latch must release the seat.
When fitted, the seat should be held securely in position.
Insert the correct key in the seat lock (if fitted).

Remove and replace the seat as described in the Service Manual, make sure the seat correctly engages in the seat latch (an audible 'click' should be heard when the seat correctly engages in the latch).
Check that the key operates the lock correctly.
Check the cable is not kinked or trapped.
If necessary lubricate the inner cable.
Check that the seat lifts easily away from the motorcycle.
Check that the seat can be fitted correctly onto the motorcycle.
Check that the seat is fitted correctly onto the motorcycle
After fitting, grasp the seat and pull firmly upwards.
Make sure the seat does not detach from the frame.
Failure to follow the advice above may lead to loss of motorcycle control which could result in serious injury or death.
